Posted By: MadTheorist (9/25/2009 2:58:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Incredible two-drop which will likely see much play in Zendikar.  
At first i underrated this card *(i still gave it 5/5 but still didn't see some further potention)*, but actually it in fact appears to be equal or even better than [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise). Although it still depends on deck, you *will* play a land most of the time, therefore despite the fact that mana accel is not granted with the Snake each turn in the lategame, this still has an amazing 2/1 body which likely makes it to one of the greatest two-drops of all time.  
Of course since the Birds are a one-drop you might simply want to play both, especially since playing the Cobra with help of Birds on turn two and then getting two further mana from the second land is insane.  
  
And in this card's block you'll find ways to get your lands into play easily, especially in green e.g. with reprinted [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow).  
  
On top of that, it even synergizes in a tribal deck. Take a look at Sakur... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Hooray for blatant green powercreep! :-/  
My theory is that the [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra) is a Freudian symbol for the m\*\*\*ive purple-veined \*\*\* Wizards is continuously ramming down our throats forcing us to splash green for quick mana acceleration or play heavy removal. It's this type of garbage that unjustly tips the scale and makes deck options in Standard so rigid and unforgiving. Vampires may be the only non-green competitive deck out there now that Cascade has been killed with [Mindbreak Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindbreak Trap). I guess you could always play [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) but that card's totally unbalanced too...

posts.post_content:
Even in Vintage, the Cobra is probably going to cause quite a shakeup.  
Turn 2: Lotus Cobra  
Turn 3: Play Fetchland, add 1 mana, fetch a land, add 1 mana, tap the 3 lands you have, you have 5 mana.  
What I can think of right now is a BG suicide deck with  
 [Verdant Catacombs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Catacombs), [Dark Confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confidant), [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra), [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf) and maybe [Nantuko Shade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nantuko Shade)

Posted By: Eggroll (9/27/2009 8:20:15 PM)

posts.post_content:
1. The card deserves to be mythic, because it lets the new fetch lands act like [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus)es, all be it on turn two at the earliest, and costing you one life, which is nowhere the same level of insanity the Old Girl could produce, thus bringing something back to the game that hasn't been seen in over a decade. Also, it makes Timmy and Spike wet themselves in about the time it takes to read the *landfall* ability, which is THE POINT of mythics.  
  
2. Sorry guys, but the fact is that EVERY deck that NEEDS the cobra to live in order to win is a COMBO deck. When it hits, you win; when it misses, you get the poop torn out of you by vampires and soldiers. BDM and Flores can mock "Doom-Blade Guy" all they want, but there is enough removal in red, white and black at low costs to force over-ambitious combo players to spend half their games sitting with Ultimatums and what not in their hand, because they can't cast them the hard way.  
  
3. Sucks to unload all your tri... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
This card is absolutely insane and is easily the most powerful card in Zendikar. It's much, much better than the birds. The kind of mana ramping that this thing provides hasn't been seen since the days of [sol ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sol ring). Check out this perfect hand:  
  
Turn 1: Forest + elves/birds  
Turn 2: tap forest and elves/birds, play cobra, play forest, play another cobra  
Turn 3: play forest and add two mana, tap lands and elves/birds, play [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper)
posts.html:
This card is absolutely insane and is easily the most powerful card in Zendikar. It's much, much better than the birds. The kind of mana ramping that this thing provides hasn't been seen since the days of sol ring. Check out this perfect hand:

Turn 1: Forest + elves/birds
Turn 2: tap forest and elves/birds, play cobra, play forest, play another cobra
Turn 3: play forest and add two mana, tap lands and elves/birds, play Terra Stomper

Posted By: Donovan_Fabian (10/1/2009 6:19:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card shows what is *right* with Zendikar, namely a card with an elegant rule system attached that is fair and balanced. this is a good card
  
This card also shows what is *wrong* with Zendikar. Namely that there are too many extra rules added as either new rules or reintroduced old rules.
  
Kicker, opponents life over ten, Ally, Traps, Landfall, Quests and Vampires are the ones that readily come to mind. It's too many rules for a mere 234 cards, it's too fussy.
  
this means that the bad cards are truly bad ([Pillarfield Ox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pillarfield Ox)) or simply confused ([Guul Draz Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guul Draz Specter))
  
I won't be buying a booster box because the ratio of good cards to bad is too low, but I will be buying singles that are good.
posts.html:

This card also shows what is wrong with Zendikar. Namely that there are too many extra rules added as either new rules or reintroduced old rules.
Kicker, opponents life over ten, Ally, Traps, Landfall, Quests and Vampires are the ones that readily come to mind. It's too many rules for a mere 234 cards, it's too fussy.
this means that the bad cards are truly bad (Pillarfield Ox) or simply confused (Guul Draz Specter)
I won't be buying a booster box because the ratio of good cards to bad is too low, but I will be buying singles that are good.

posts.post_content: In most decks, when are you gonna get this, and wish you hadn't drawn an elf or bird? Seriously? It is a 1 toughness creature, so it sucks in combo, it is inefficient for aggro, and control has better things to be doing than syphoning it's own mana. The only place this card has a real home is in Zoo. Only good if you can cheat good enough to never get caught, and always get godhands. Otherwise, it sits there.

Posted By: Designer_Genes (9/30/2009 9:43:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Should have been printed as a common and been the new [Quirion Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quirion Elves)...only better...much better. Any Standard/Extended deck with green as one of its colors will be stronger with them than without them and that may even go for a lot of Vintage and Legacy decks. It's much more true of these snakes than it is of mana birds since the snakes are faster.
  
   
With fetch lands going into practically every tournament deck, this guy easily gives a boost of +2 mana already on turn 3 and can attack for 2 if unblocked as well. If playing/using a fetch land in a given turn, it can even pay its own mana back immediately.
